org.vertx.java.core.file

Class FileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vertx.java.core.file.FileSystem

  • public class FileSystem
extends java.lang.Object

    Represents the file-system and contains a broad set of operations for manipulating files.

    Author:
    Tim Fox

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static FileSystem instance

      • copyDeferred

        public Deferred<java.lang.Void> copyDeferred(java.lang.String from,
                                    java.lang.String to)
        The same as copy(String, String) but the copy does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • copy

        public Future<java.lang.Void> copy(java.lang.String from,
                          java.lang.String to)
        Copy a file from the path from to path to, asynchronously.

        The copy will fail if the destination if the destination already exists.

        The actual copy will happen asynchronously.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

      • copyDeferred

        public Deferred<java.lang.Void> copyDeferred(java.lang.String from,
                                    java.lang.String to,
                                    boolean recursive)
        The same as copy(String, String, boolean) but the copy does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • copy

        public Future<java.lang.Void> copy(java.lang.String from,
                          java.lang.String to,
                          boolean recursive)
        Copy a file from the path from to path to, asynchronously.

        If recursive is true and from represents a directory, then the directory and its contents will be copied recursively to the destination to.

        The copy will fail if the destination if the destination already exists.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

        The move will fail if the destination already exists.

        The actual move will happen asynchronously.

      • truncate

        public Future<java.lang.Void> truncate(java.lang.String path,
                              long len)
        Truncate the file represented by path to length len in bytes, asynchronously.

        The operation will fail if the file does not exist or len is less than zero.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

      • chmodDeferred

      • chmod

        public Future<java.lang.Void> chmod(java.lang.String path,
                           java.lang.String perms)
        Change the permissions on the file represented by path to perms, asynchronously. The permission String takes the form rwxr-x--- as specified here.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

      • chmodDeferred

        public Deferred<java.lang.Void> chmodDeferred(java.lang.String path,
                                     java.lang.String perms,
                                     java.lang.String dirPerms)
        The same as chmod(String, String, String) but the chmod does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • chmod

        public Future<java.lang.Void> chmod(java.lang.String path,
                           java.lang.String perms,
                           java.lang.String dirPerms)
        Change the permissions on the file represented by path to perms, asynchronously. The permission String takes the form rwxr-x--- as specified in {here}.

        If the file is directory then all contents will also have their permissions changed recursively. Any directory permissions will be set to dirPerms, whilst any normal file permissions will be set to perms.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

      • propsDeferred

        public Deferred<FileProps> propsDeferred(java.lang.String path)

        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • props

        public Future<FileProps> props(java.lang.String path)
        Obtain properties for the file represented by path, asynchronously. If the file is a link, the link will be followed.
        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

        public Future<FileProps> lprops(java.lang.String path)

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

      • delete

        public Future<java.lang.Void> delete(java.lang.String path,
                            boolean recursive)
        Deletes the file represented by the specified path, asynchronously.

        If the path represents a directory, then the directory and its contents will be deleted recursively.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

      • mkdir

        public Future<java.lang.Void> mkdir(java.lang.String path)
        Create the directory represented by path, asynchronously.

        The operation will fail if the directory already exists.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

      • mkdirDeferred

        public Deferred<java.lang.Void> mkdirDeferred(java.lang.String path,
                                     boolean createParents)
        The same as mkdir(String, boolean) but the mkdir does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • mkdir

        public Future<java.lang.Void> mkdir(java.lang.String path,
                           boolean createParents)
        Create the directory represented by path, asynchronously.

        If createParents is set to true then any non-existent parent directories of the directory will also be created.

        The operation will fail if the directory already exists.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

      • mkdirDeferred

        public Deferred<java.lang.Void> mkdirDeferred(java.lang.String path,
                                     java.lang.String perms)
        The same as mkdir(String, String) but the mkdir does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • mkdir

        public Future<java.lang.Void> mkdir(java.lang.String path,
                           java.lang.String perms)
        Create the directory represented by path, asynchronously.

        The new directory will be created with permissions as specified by perms. The permission String takes the form rwxr-x--- as specified in here.

        The operation will fail if the directory already exists.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

      • mkdirDeferred

        public Deferred<java.lang.Void> mkdirDeferred(java.lang.String path,
                                     java.lang.String perms,
                                     boolean createParents)
        The same as mkdir(String, String, boolean) but the mkdir does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • mkdir

        public Future<java.lang.Void> mkdir(java.lang.String path,
                           java.lang.String perms,
                           boolean createParents)
        Create the directory represented by path, asynchronously.

        The new directory will be created with permissions as specified by perms. The permission String takes the form rwxr-x--- as specified in here.

        If createParents is set to true then any non-existent parent directories of the directory will also be created.

        The operation will fail if the directory already exists.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

      • readDirDeferred

        public Deferred<java.lang.String[]> readDirDeferred(java.lang.String path)
        The same as readDir(String) but the read does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • readDir

        public Future<java.lang.String[]> readDir(java.lang.String path)
        Read the contents of the directory specified by path, asynchronously
        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action. The result is an array of String representing the paths of the files inside the directory.

      • readDirDeferred

        public Deferred<java.lang.String[]> readDirDeferred(java.lang.String path,
                                           java.lang.String filter)
        The same as readDir(String, String) but the read does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • readDir

        public Future<java.lang.String[]> readDir(java.lang.String path,
                                 java.lang.String filter)
        Read the contents of the directory specified by path, asynchronously

        filter is a regular expression. If filter is specified then only the paths that match @{filter} will be returned.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action. The result is an array of String representing the paths of the files inside the directory.

      • readFileDeferred

        public Deferred<Buffer> readFileDeferred(java.lang.String path)
        The same as readFile(String) but the read does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • readFile

        public Future<Buffer> readFile(java.lang.String path)
        Reads the entire file as represented by the path path as a Buffer, asynchronously.

        Do not user this method to read very large files or you risk running out of available RAM.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

      • writeFileDeferred

      • open

        public Future<AsyncFile> open(java.lang.String path)
        Open the file represented by path, asynchronously.

        The file is opened for both reading and writing. If the file does not already exist it will be created. Write operations will not automatically flush to storage.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

      • openDeferred

        public Deferred<AsyncFile> openDeferred(java.lang.String path,
                               java.lang.String perms)
        The same as open(String, String) but the open does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • open

        public Future<AsyncFile> open(java.lang.String path,
                     java.lang.String perms)
        Open the file represented by path, asynchronously.

        The file is opened for both reading and writing. If the file does not already exist it will be created with the permissions as specified by perms. Write operations will not automatically flush to storage.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

      • openDeferred

        public Deferred<AsyncFile> openDeferred(java.lang.String path,
                               java.lang.String perms,
                               boolean createNew)
        The same as open(String, String, boolean) but the open does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • open

        public Future<AsyncFile> open(java.lang.String path,
                     java.lang.String perms,
                     boolean createNew)
        Open the file represented by path, asynchronously.

        The file is opened for both reading and writing. If the file does not already exist and createNew is true it will be created with the permissions as specified by perms, otherwise the operation will fail. Write operations will not automatically flush to storage.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

      • openDeferred

        public Deferred<AsyncFile> openDeferred(java.lang.String path,
                               java.lang.String perms,
                               boolean read,
                               boolean write,
                               boolean createNew)
        The same as open(String, String, boolean, boolean, boolean) but the open does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • open

        public Future<AsyncFile> open(java.lang.String path,
                     java.lang.String perms,
                     boolean read,
                     boolean write,
                     boolean createNew)
        Open the file represented by path, asynchronously.

        If read is true the file will be opened for reading. If write is true the file will be opened for writing.

        If the file does not already exist and createNew is true it will be created with the permissions as specified by perms, otherwise the operation will fail.

        Write operations will not automatically flush to storage.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.

      • openDeferred

        public Deferred<AsyncFile> openDeferred(java.lang.String path,
                               java.lang.String perms,
                               boolean read,
                               boolean write,
                               boolean createNew,
                               boolean flush)
        The same as open(String, String, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean) but the open does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • open

        public Future<AsyncFile> open(java.lang.String path,
                     java.lang.String perms,
                     boolean read,
                     boolean write,
                     boolean createNew,
                     boolean flush)
        Open the file represented by path, asynchronously.

        If read is true the file will be opened for reading. If write is true the file will be opened for writing.

        If the file does not already exist and createNew is true it will be created with the permissions as specified by perms, otherwise the operation will fail.

        If flush is true then all writes will be automatically flushed through OS buffers to the underlying storage on each write.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the action.
